intro: Erigeron semiamplexicaulis var. scorzonerifolius, commonly known as the Scorzonerifolius fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves that are often clasping around the stem, giving it a unique appearance. Its flowers are typically pale blue or white, arranged in a flat-topped cluster. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils.
